Key Match Events: Juan Soto hit a 402-foot home run in the bottom of the 6th inning, turning the game in favor of the Yankees.
The Royals tied the game in the top of the 7th inning with a sacrifice fly by Salvador Perez.
The game went into extras after the Yankees tied it in the bottom of the 11th inning on an infield single by Jazz Chisholm Jr.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees had struggled with minimal base runners and a lifeless offense before Soto's injury scare.
Manager Aaron Boone opted to use Clay Holmes in the 7th inning despite the Royals' right-handed-heavy lineup.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone and players expressed pride in the team's resilience and ability to grind out a win despite challenges.
Jazz Chisholm Jr. compared the intensity of the game to a playoff atmosphere.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game lasted 11 innings, extending the Yankees' lead in the American League East.
The Royals had three right-handed hitters in the lineup, but the Yankees managed to tie the game late.
